body.p: This is the homepage for the free tn5250 emulator. It’s sometimes described as “Linux tn5250”, although it works on FreeBSD and any other modern Unix.
tn5250 is a telnet client for the IBM AS/400 that emulates 5250 terminals and printers. This function is the same as that provided by the 5250 emulator in IBM Client Access.
The tn5250 project is kindly hosted by SourceForge. Thanks!
Michael Madore is the principal author of tn5250 — he got the whole thing going.
Jay Felice has done a lot of good work on tn5250 as well, and provided the CVS server and download site for a few years.
Scott Klement has gotten himself into the ChangeLog a bit, too.

Carey Evans, your humble narrator, hasn’t done much; he contributed the initial automake support and left it for Michael and Jay to get working, wrote the man pages, and got the project set up on SourceForge.
Many others have contributed bug reports, feature requests, patches and suggestions. Thanks to you all!

The source for the latest stable version of tn5250 should be able to be downloaded from the Sourceforge files page. Debian users can install it via apt: apt-get install tn5250. RedHat users can download RPMs prepared by Henri Gomez.
Discussion about tn5250 takes place on the LINUX5250 mailing list, which is located at MIDRANGE dot COM. The mailing list archives are also available there.
You can report bugs and send patches to the mailing list, or use the SourceForge Trackers on the tn5250 project pages.
There is also a tn5250 FAQ available. It’s a little out of date, but still contains useful information.
As well as the resources for users listed above, the CVS repository is hosted on SourceForge. See the tn5250 CVS page.
There’s also a page of links to related documentation at this site.
tn5250j is a 5250 emulator written in Java.
x3270 implements the tn3270 protocol, which is very similar to tn5250.
